item.title: Escape to Paradise: The History of Don the Beachcomber Las Vegas
item.description:
A Desert Oasis: Introducing Don the Beachcomber at the Sahara

The 1960s in Las Vegas were a time of bold experimentation and extravagant themed experiences. Casinos werenâ€™t just places to gamble; they were destinations offering complete escapes. Among the many contenders for immersive entertainment, Don the Beachcomber at the Sahara Hotel stood out, becoming a beloved icon of vintage Las Vegas. Opened on December 1, 1962, this wasn’t just a restaurant; it was a portal to a lush Polynesian paradise, a stark and welcome contrast to the arid Nevada landscape just beyond its walls.
